events.name: Putin visits Russian-controlled regions in Ukraine
events.wd_label: Putin visits Russian-controlled regions in Ukraine
events.wd_description: Russian President Vladimir Putin visited parts of Ukraine's southern Kherson and Luhansk regions controlled by Russia. Russia claimed to have annexed both regions, but they do not have full control.
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin visited parts of Ukraine's southern Kherson and Luhansk regions controlled by Russia. Russia claimed to have annexed both regions, but they do not have full control.

events.name: Putin's interaction with the military
events.wd_description: During his visit, Putin told the military that he felt it was important to hear their opinion on the developing situation, listen to them, and exchange information.
events.description: During his visit, Putin told the military that he felt it was important to hear their opinion on the developing situation, listen to them, and exchange information.

events.name: Ukrainian response
events.wd_description: Mykhailo Podolyak, an adviser to Zelensky's office, tweeted that Putin was touring the occupied and ruined territories of Ukraine to enjoy the crimes committed by his military.
events.description: Mykhailo Podolyak, an adviser to Zelensky's office, tweeted that Putin was touring the occupied and ruined territories of Ukraine to enjoy the crimes committed by his military.

events.name: Ceasefire announced between Sudanese Armed Forces and Rapid Support Forces
events.wd_label: Ceasefire announced between Sudanese Armed Forces and Rapid Support Forces
events.wd_description: The United States and Saudi Arabia announced a 24-hour ceasefire between the Sudanese Armed Forces and the Rapid Support Forces, set to start on Saturday.
events.description: The United States and Saudi Arabia announced a 24-hour ceasefire between the Sudanese Armed Forces and the Rapid Support Forces, set to start on Saturday.

events.name: Statement by Saudi Arabia's Foreign Ministry
events.wd_label: Statement by Saudi Arabia's Foreign Ministry
events.wd_description: Saudi Arabia and the US expressed frustration over the non-commitment of previous truces and announced the agreement to allow humanitarian aid movement across Sudan.
events.description: Saudi Arabia and the US expressed frustration over the non-commitment of previous truces and announced the agreement to allow humanitarian aid movement across Sudan.

events.name: Declaration of persona non grata
events.wd_description: Sudan's foreign ministry notified the United Nations that Volker Perthes, the special representative of the UN Secretary-General in Sudan, had been declared persona non grata.
events.description: Sudan's foreign ministry notified the United Nations that Volker Perthes, the special representative of the UN Secretary-General in Sudan, had been declared persona non grata.

events.name: Russia launches fresh drone and missile strikes on Ukraine
events.wd_label: Russia launches fresh drone and missile strikes on Ukraine
events.wd_description: Russia launched new waves of drones and missile strikes on Ukraine, with explosions heard in Kyiv and five people injured in what was described as the most significant kamikaze drone attack so far.
events.description: Russia launched new waves of drones and missile strikes on Ukraine, with explosions heard in Kyiv and five people injured in what was described as the most significant kamikaze drone attack so far.

events.name: Details of the attack
events.wd_description: The attack by Russia was launched shortly after midnight and lasted for over four hours, with Iranian-made Shahed kamikaze drones seen across the country.
events.description: The attack by Russia was launched shortly after midnight and lasted for over four hours, with Iranian-made Shahed kamikaze drones seen across the country.

events.name: Kyiv's response
events.wd_description: The Mayor of Kyiv, Vitaliy Klitschko, confirmed that close to 60 drones were launched by Russia, making it the most significant attack of such kind. Emergency services responded after drone wreckages fell on a runway at Khuliany international airport.
events.description: The Mayor of Kyiv, Vitaliy Klitschko, confirmed that close to 60 drones were launched by Russia, making it the most significant attack of such kind. Emergency services responded after drone wreckages fell on a runway at Khuliany international airport.

events.name: Injuries and damages
events.wd_description: Five people were injured in Kyiv during the attack, with drone wreckages causing damage at Khuliany international airport.
events.description: Five people were injured in Kyiv during the attack, with drone wreckages causing damage at Khuliany international airport.

events.name: Announcement by Ukrainian President
events.wd_description: The President of Ukraine announced that May 9 would be celebrated as Europe Day.
events.description: The President of Ukraine announced that May 9 would be celebrated as Europe Day.

events.name: Cornell study on U.S. EV battery production and sustainability
events.wd_label: Cornell study on U.S. EV battery production and sustainability
events.wd_description: A Cornell study examines the long-term energy and sustainability prospects of U.S. EV battery production and highlights policy approaches for building a more resilient battery supply chain.
events.description: A Cornell study examines the long-term energy and sustainability prospects of U.S. EV battery production and highlights policy approaches for building a more resilient battery supply chain.

events.name: Federal government incentives
events.wd_description: The federal government is incentivizing the expansion of domestic electric-vehicle battery manufacturing to reduce dependence on foreign imports and unpredictable global supply chains.
events.description: The federal government is incentivizing the expansion of domestic electric-vehicle battery manufacturing to reduce dependence on foreign imports and unpredictable global supply chains.

events.name: Study publication
events.wd_description: A study published in Science Advances provides a comprehensive energy and environmental analysis of reshoring lithium-ion EV batteries, considering the entire life cycle.
events.description: A study published in Science Advances provides a comprehensive energy and environmental analysis of reshoring lithium-ion EV batteries, considering the entire life cycle.

events.name: Benefits of reshoring
events.wd_description: Reshoring could reduce the overall carbon footprint of U.S. EV batteries and the energy needed to produce them, with benefits varying based on technology advances, supply chain restructuring, and EV adoption.
events.description: Reshoring could reduce the overall carbon footprint of U.S. EV batteries and the energy needed to produce them, with benefits varying based on technology advances, supply chain restructuring, and EV adoption.

events.name: Importance of recycled materials
events.wd_description: Utilizing recycled aluminum and nickel can reduce the carbon footprint by up to 26% for the pre-pandemic U.S. electric vehicle fleet.
events.description: Utilizing recycled aluminum and nickel can reduce the carbon footprint by up to 26% for the pre-pandemic U.S. electric vehicle fleet.

events.name: Ally-shoring strategy
events.wd_description: The study examined an ally-shoring strategy, reallocating production capacities for refined metals and battery components to Japan, South Korea, and European Union countries.
events.description: The study examined an ally-shoring strategy, reallocating production capacities for refined metals and battery components to Japan, South Korea, and European Union countries.

events.name: Key findings
events.wd_description: Key findings include a potential 27% reduction in carbon footprint by increasing onshoring and ally production, enhanced sustainability with renewable energy, and a 54% improvement in climate change mitigation with strategic integration.
events.description: Key findings include a potential 27% reduction in carbon footprint by increasing onshoring and ally production, enhanced sustainability with renewable energy, and a 54% improvement in climate change mitigation with strategic integration.

events.name: Environmental tradeoffs
events.wd_description: Reshoring could reduce ecotoxicity and particulate matter formation by over 30% from secondary nickel supply, but may decrease performance in ozone formation, ozone depletion, and ionizing radiation due to increased overseas transportation distance.
events.description: Reshoring could reduce ecotoxicity and particulate matter formation by over 30% from secondary nickel supply, but may decrease performance in ozone formation, ozone depletion, and ionizing radiation due to increased overseas transportation distance.

events.name: Importance of advanced modeling
events.wd_description: Advanced modeling and systems analysis are essential for considering environmental tradeoffs in lithium-ion battery production and securing a resilient value chain amidst uncertain markets and evolving technologies.
events.description: Advanced modeling and systems analysis are essential for considering environmental tradeoffs in lithium-ion battery production and securing a resilient value chain amidst uncertain markets and evolving technologies.
